DataElement.preferredName: Participant Declined Curative Modality Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text term to specify the reason someone who takes part in an activity declines curative modality therapy as a criteria required to be eligible to participate in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Refuse Cure Modality Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity._To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something._Any action or response that serves to eliminate disease and prevent recurrence._A specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, any therapeutic agent or method of treatment, especially involving the physical treatment of a condition._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Property.preferredName: Refuse Cure Modality Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.:Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy.:A specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, any therapeutic agent or method of treatment, especially involving the physical treatment of a condition.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.
Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy.
A specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, any therapeutic agent or method of treatment, especially involving the physical treatment of a condition.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/29/2021: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredName: Participant Declined Curative Modality Therapy Reason
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Beyond normal limits; unrestrained.: A disease or the incidence of disease within a population. Morbidity also refers to adverse effects caused by a treatment.

Concepts.definition: Morbidity; the relative incidence of a particular disease in a population.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
